channel.title: Space on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Space on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: After a partly successful test flight, European firm eyes space station mission
item.description: “One year ago, this was out of the discussion.”

item.title: Rocket Report: SpaceX won’t land at Johnston Atoll; new North Sea launch site
item.description: “Europe is seizing the opportunity to lead.”

item.title: Amazon’s ride on the rocket merry-go-round continues with SpaceX launch
item.description: Amazon has launched 78 of its planned 3,232 Kuiper broadband satellites.

item.title: The ISS is nearing retirement, so why is NASA still gung-ho about Starliner?
item.description: NASA is doing all it can to ensure Boeing doesn’t abandon the Starliner program.

item.title: Congress moves to reject bulk of White House’s proposed NASA cuts
item.description: We’re still months away from these budget bills having a chance to become law.

item.title: ‘Not that into peace doves’: The Apollo-Soyuz patch NASA rejected
item.description: Paul Calle thought he had represented the Apollo-Soyuz Test Project.

item.title: We saw the heart of Pluto 10 years ago—it’ll be a long wait to see the rest
item.description: A 50-year wait for a second mission wouldn’t be surprising. Just ask Uranus and Neptune.

item.title: Texas governor says his emails with Elon Musk are too ‘intimate or embarrassing’ to release
item.description: Texas Governor Greg Abbott is refusing to release months’ worth of emails sent to Elon Musk and his companies under public records laws, according to a joint report from ProPublica, The Texas Ne

item.title: The Structure of Ice in Space Is Neither Order nor Chaos—It’s Both
item.description: Long thought to be completely disordered, space ice appears to have some crystallized regions, new research suggests.

item.title: The Structure of Ice in Space Is Neither Order nor Chaos—It’s Both
item.description: Long thought to be completely disordered, space ice appears to have some crystallized regions, new research suggests.

item.title: Everything We Know About the Interstellar Object 3I/ATLAS
item.description: A team of astronomers recently discovered the traveling space object, just the third of its kind to pass through our solar system.

item.title: Everything We Know About the Interstellar Object 3I/ATLAS
item.description: A team of astronomers recently discovered the traveling space object, just the third of its kind to pass through our solar system.

item.title: How to Watch the Southern Delta Aquariids and Perseids Meteor Showers
item.description: In July and August two spectacular meteor showers will arrive in quick succession. Here’s everything you need to know to watch them and the other major showers that will appear in 2025.

item.title: How to Watch the Southern Delta Aquariids and Perseids Meteor Showers
item.description: In July and August two spectacular meteor showers will arrive in quick succession. Here’s everything you need to know to watch them and the other major showers that will appear in 2025.

item.title: Rocket Report: SpaceX to make its own propellant; China’s largest launch pad
item.description: United Launch Alliance begins stacking its third Vulcan rocket for the second time.

item.title: It’s hunting season in orbit as Russia’s killer satellites mystify skywatchers
item.description: “Once more, we play our dangerous game—a game of chess—against our old adversary.”

item.title: “It’s a heist”: Senator calls out Texas for trying to steal shuttle from Smithsonian
item.description: “The title of this amendment is ‘Houston, We Have a Problem.’”

item.title: Nearly everyone opposes Trump’s plan to kill space traffic control program
item.description: Space Force officials and more than 450 aerospace companies are against the White House’s proposal.
